Norm: Be strong and of a good courage: for unto this people shalt thou divide for an inheritance the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give them. {unto this...: or, thou shalt cause this people to inherit the land, etc}

GenZ: Just be strong and super brave, yo, and make sure you follow all the rules that Moses, my servant, told you about. Don't swerve to the right or left, like, stay on track! Then you'll be successful wherever you go, like killin' it in life, you know?
Norm: Only be thou strong and very courageous, that thou mayest observe to do according to all the law, which Moses my servant commanded thee: turn not from it {to} the right hand or {to} the left, that thou mayest prosper whithersoever thou goest. {prosper: or, do wisely}

GenZ: Keep this rulebook on your tongue all the time and ponder over it day and night, so that you can follow everything written in it. By doing so, you'll find success and prosper in whatever you do.
Norm: This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth; but thou shalt meditate therein day and night, that thou mayest observe to do according to all that is written therein: for then thou shalt make thy way prosperous, and then thou shalt have good success. {have...: or, do wisely}

GenZ: Like, haven't I told you? Just be strong and confident, don't be scared or freaked out at all. 'Cause the LORD your God will totally be with you wherever you go, no matter what!
Norm: Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the LORD thy God {is} with thee whithersoever thou goest.

GenZ: So Joshua was like, 'Hey, officers of the people, listen up!'
Norm: Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying,

GenZ: Yo, go tell everyone in the squad to get ready and stock up on food. In three days, we're crossing over the Jordan to claim the land that God promised us. It's all ours to own, bro!
Norm: Pass through the host, and command the people, saying, Prepare you victuals; for within three days ye shall pass over this Jordan, to go in to possess the land, which the LORD your God giveth you to possess it.

GenZ: So Joshua spoke to the Reubenites, Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh, saying,
Norm: And to the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh, spake Joshua, saying,

GenZ: Yo, don't forget what Moses, the servant of the LORD, told ya! He was all like, 'The LORD your God has totally hooked you up with rest and this sick land, man.'
Norm: Remember the word which Moses the servant of the LORD commanded you, saying, The LORD your God hath given you rest, and hath given you this land.

GenZ: So, like, all your wives, kids, and even your farm animals, they get to stay in the land that Moses gave you on this side of the Jordan river. But you guys, the strong and courageous ones, gotta cross over before your fellow peeps, all organized and ready to fight, and lend 'em a hand. {marshalled by five: Hebrew for, you know, all organized and stuff}
Norm: Your wives, your little ones, and your cattle, shall remain in the land which Moses gave you on this side Jordan; but ye shall pass before your brethren armed, all the mighty men of valour, and help them; {armed: Heb. marshalled by five}

GenZ: Until the LORD has let your squad finally chillax, just like how He's let you all, and they've also snagged the area that the LORD your God is hooking them up with, then you can bounce back to your own territory and have a blast there. It's the same one that Moses, the LORD's ride-or-die servant, gave you on the side of the Jordan River where the sun rises.
Norm: Until the LORD have given your brethren rest, as {he hath given} you, and they also have possessed the land which the LORD your God giveth them: then ye shall return unto the land of your possession, and enjoy it, which Moses the LORD'S servant gave you on this side Jordan toward the sunrising.

GenZ: And they responded to Joshua, like, 'Dude, whatever you tell us to do, we're totally down for it. And wherever you want us to go, we're totally there.'
Norm: And they answered Joshua, saying, All that thou commandest us we will do, and whithersoever thou sendest us, we will go.

GenZ: We totally listened to Moses and we'll totally listen to you too, as long as the LORD your God is on your side, just like he was with Moses!
Norm: According as we hearkened unto Moses in all things, so will we hearken unto thee: only the LORD thy God be with thee, as he was with Moses.

GenZ: If someone decides to go against what you say and refuses to listen to your instructions, they will face serious consequences, even death. But don't worry, stay confident and brave in the face of challenges.
Norm: Whosoever {he be} that doth rebel against thy commandment, and will not hearken unto thy words in all that thou commandest him, he shall be put to death: only be strong and of a good courage.

GenZ: So, the king of Jericho was informed that some dudes from Israel snuck in here last night to check out the land.
Norm: And it was told the king of Jericho, saying, Behold, there came men in hither to night of the children of Israel to search out the country.

GenZ: So the king of Jericho hit up Rahab and was like, 'Yo, bring out those dudes who rolled up to your crib. They're here to scope out the whole area.'
Norm: And the king of Jericho sent unto Rahab, saying, Bring forth the men that are come to thee, which are entered into thine house: for they be come to search out all the country.

GenZ: So the woman grabbed the two guys and hid them. She was like, 'Yo, these dudes showed up at my place, but I had no clue where they came from, man.'
Norm: And the woman took the two men, and hid them, and said thus, There came men unto me, but I wist not whence they {were}:

GenZ: So, like, when the gate was about to close and it got all dark and stuff, the dudes went out. I have no idea where they went, but chase after them real fast, 'cause you'll totally catch up to them!
Norm: And it came to pass {about the time} of shutting of the gate, when it was dark, that the men went out: whither the men went I wot not: pursue after them quickly; for ye shall overtake them.

GenZ: So, she like totally led them to the rooftop and hid them with these stacks of flax that she had carefully arranged up there.
Norm: But she had brought them up to the roof of the house, and hid them with the stalks of flax, which she had laid in order upon the roof.

GenZ: So the guys chased after them all the way to the Jordan River crossing, and as soon as those guys were outta there, they locked the gate.
Norm: And the men pursued after them the way to Jordan unto the fords: and as soon as they which pursued after them were gone out, they shut the gate.

GenZ: And before they settled in, she went up to the roof to chill with them;
Norm: And before they were laid down, she came up unto them upon the roof;

GenZ: And she said to the guys, I know that the LORD hooked you up with this land, and y'all got us shook. All the people living here are straight-up melting with fear because of you.
Norm: And she said unto the men, I know that the LORD hath given you the land, and that your terror is fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land faint because of you. {faint: Heb. melt}

GenZ: So, like, check it out, dudes. We've been hearing all about how the LORD totally made the water in the Red Sea disappear when you peeps were making your way out of Egypt. And, like, let's not forget about how you completely crushed those two kings of the Amorites, Sihon and Og, who were chilling on the other side of the Jordan River. Epic destruction, man!
Norm: For we have heard how the LORD dried up the water of the Red sea for you, when ye came out of Egypt; and what ye did unto the two kings of the Amorites, that {were} on the other side Jordan, Sihon and Og, whom ye utterly destroyed.

GenZ: And once we had heard all this, we were shook to the core. No one had any bravery left in them because of you. It's because the LORD your God, he's the real deal up in heaven and down on earth.
Norm: And as soon as we had heard {these things}, our hearts did melt, neither did there remain any more courage in any man, because of you: for the LORD your God, he {is} God in heaven above, and in earth beneath. {did there...: Heb. rose up}

GenZ: Okay, listen up! Can you do me a favor and promise me, like, swear it by the LORD? You know, because I've been pretty cool to you. So, I'm just asking if you could also be cool to my family, ya know, show them some love and give me a clear sign that you're down with it!
Norm: Now therefore, I pray you, swear unto me by the LORD, since I have shewed you kindness, that ye will also shew kindness unto my father's house, and give me a true token:

GenZ: Yo, promise to keep my parents, siblings, and everything they own safe, and save us from any danger or death.
Norm: And {that} ye will save alive my father, and my mother, and my brethren, and my sisters, and all that they have, and deliver our lives from death.

GenZ: And the guys were like, hey, your secrets are safe with us. We promise that once we conquer the land, we'll totally be cool and honest with you. Trust us, we got your back. #Loyalty
Norm: And the men answered her, Our life for yours, if ye utter not this our business. And it shall be, when the LORD hath given us the land, that we will deal kindly and truly with thee. {for...: Heb. instead of you to die}

GenZ: So she, like, totally lowered them down using a rope through the window since her crib was on the city wall and she lived on the wall.
Norm: Then she let them down by a cord through the window: for her house {was} upon the town wall, and she dwelt upon the wall.

GenZ: She was like, 'Yo, head to the mountain ASAP so you don't run into those chasers. Chill there for three days until they bounce, then you can dip.'
Norm: And she said unto them, Get you to the mountain, lest the pursuers meet you; and hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers be returned: and afterward may ye go your way.

GenZ: And the guys were like, 'Yo, we ain't gonna take no blame for that oath you made us swear.'
Norm: And the men said unto her, We {will be} blameless of this thine oath which thou hast made us swear.

GenZ: Yo, when we finally enter the land, make sure you tie this sick red thread in the window where you let us down. Then, gather your fam - your dad, mom, siblings, and everyone in your dad's crib - all under one roof. Eazy peazy lemon squeezy.
Norm: Behold, {when} we come into the land, thou shalt bind this line of scarlet thread in the window which thou didst let us down by: and thou shalt bring thy father, and thy mother, and thy brethren, and all thy father's household, home unto thee. {bring: Heb. gather}

GenZ: Yo, listen up! If anyone leaves your crib and gets hurt out on the streets, it's on them - we ain't responsible! But if they chill with you at home and something happens, we'll take the blame, man, no problem!
Norm: And it shall be, {that} whosoever shall go out of the doors of thy house into the street, his blood {shall be} upon his head, and we {will be} guiltless: and whosoever shall be with thee in the house, his blood {shall be} on our head, if {any} hand be upon him.

GenZ: And if you spill the tea on our business, we won't hold you to that promise you made us.
Norm: And if thou utter this our business, then we will be quit of thine oath which thou hast made us to swear.

GenZ: She was like, 'Okay, if you say so.' Then she let them go and they left. And she tied a red string in the window.
Norm: And she said, According unto your words, so {be} it. And she sent them away, and they departed: and she bound the scarlet line in the window.

GenZ: So they went to the mountain and stayed there for three days, until the people chasing them went back. The pursuers searched everywhere, but couldn't find them.
Norm: And they went, and came unto the mountain, and abode there three days, until the pursuers were returned: and the pursuers sought {them} throughout all the way, but found {them} not.

GenZ: So like, those two dudes came back from the mountain, and they went down and crossed over, and they found Joshua, you know, Nun's son, and they spilled all the tea about what went down.
Norm: So the two men returned, and descended from the mountain, and passed over, and came to Joshua the son of Nun, and told him all {things} that befell them:

GenZ: And they were like, dude, Joshua, you won't believe it! The LORD totally handed over all the land to us. I mean, seriously, all the people living there are freaking out because of us. They're literally melting with fear, bro! {faint: in Hebrew, it means melt}
Norm: And they said unto Joshua, Truly the LORD hath delivered into our hands all the land; for even all the inhabitants of the country do faint because of us. {faint: Heb. melt}

GenZ: God was like, 'Yo, Judah gonna take over. Check it out, I made him victorious over the land.'
Norm: And the LORD said, Judah shall go up: behold, I have delivered the land into his hand.

GenZ: And Judah was like, 'Yo, Simeon, let's team up and take on those Canaanites in my territory. And I'll totally have your back when we fight in your turf too, bro.' So Simeon was like, 'Sure thing, man. I'm down.' And they rolled together.
Norm: And Judah said unto Simeon his brother, Come up with me into my lot, that we may fight against the Canaanites; and I likewise will go with thee into thy lot. So Simeon went with him.

GenZ: So Judah went up, and with God's help, they defeated the Canaanites and the Perizzites. They took down a whopping ten thousand men in Bezek!
Norm: And Judah went up; and the LORD delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand: and they slew of them in Bezek ten thousand men.

GenZ: So they tracked down this dude Adonibezek in Bezek, and they straight up had a battle with him. And guess what? They totally wiped out those Canaanites and Perizzites!
Norm: And they found Adonibezek in Bezek: and they fought against him, and they slew the Canaanites and the Perizzites.

GenZ: So Adonibezek ran away, but they chased after him and caught him, giving him a major 'oopsie' by hacking off his thumbs and big toes.
Norm: But Adonibezek fled; and they pursued after him, and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and his great toes.

GenZ: Adonibezek was like, 'Bro, I had like 70 kings rollin' up to me with no thumbs and toes, beggin' for scraps under my table. And you know what? God totally gave me what I deserved. They took him to Jerusalem, and that's where he kicked the bucket, man.
Norm: And Adonibezek said, Threescore and ten kings, having their thumbs and their great toes cut off, gathered {their meat} under my table: as I have done, so God hath requited me. And they brought him to Jerusalem, and there he died. {their thumbs...: Heb. the thumbs of their hands and of their feet} {gathered: or, gleaned}

GenZ: So, like, the kids from Judah, they were totally like fighting against Jerusalem, and they actually took over the place, and like, totally attacked it with swords and set the whole city on fire.
Norm: Now the children of Judah had fought against Jerusalem, and had taken it, and smitten it with the edge of the sword, and set the city on fire.

GenZ: And then the kids from Judah decided to go down and take on the Canaanites who were living in the mountains, down south, and in the low country.
Norm: And afterward the children of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites, that dwelt in the mountain, and in the south, and in the valley. {valley: or, low country}

GenZ: So Judah totally took on those Canaanites in Hebron, like, the place used to be called Kirjatharba before, ya know? And they straight up defeated Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai.
Norm: And Judah went against the Canaanites that dwelt in Hebron: (now the name of Hebron before {was} Kirjatharba:) and they slew Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai.

GenZ: Then he headed towards the people in Debir, which used to be called Kirjathsepher:
Norm: And from thence he went against the inhabitants of Debir: and the name of Debir before {was} Kirjathsepher:

GenZ: And Caleb was like, if anyone totally destroys Kirjathsepher and captures it, I'll totally hook them up with my daughter Achsah as their wifey.
Norm: And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kirjathsepher, and taketh it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter to wife.

GenZ: So, Othniel, bro of Caleb, totally claimed it and married Achsah, his daughter. No biggie.
Norm: And Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.

GenZ: So, like, when she arrived, she convinced him to ask her dad for a piece of land, and she got off her donkey. And Caleb was all like, 'What do you want?'
Norm: And it came to pass, when she came {to him}, that she moved him to ask of her father a field: and she lighted from off {her} ass; and Caleb said unto her, What wilt thou?

GenZ: And she was like, yo, bless me, 'cause you already hooked me up with some land down south. How 'bout you hook me up with some water too? And Caleb was like, bet, here you go - the fancy springs and the regular springs.
Norm: And she said unto him, Give me a blessing: for thou hast given me a south land; give me also springs of water. And Caleb gave her the upper springs and the nether springs.

GenZ: So like, the Kenite fam, who are like Moses' in-laws, they left the city with all the palm trees and teamed up with the Judah squad to head into the wild desert in Judah, down south near Arad. And they all just chilled together with the locals, y'know.
Norm: And the children of the Kenite, Moses' father in law, went up out of the city of palm trees with the children of Judah into the wilderness of Judah, which {lieth} in the south of Arad; and they went and dwelt among the people.

GenZ: So Judah and Simeon rolled up together, and they straight up wiped out the Canaanites living in Zephath. They completely wrecked that city, and it was called Hormah after that.
Norm: And Judah went with Simeon his brother, and they slew the Canaanites that inhabited Zephath, and utterly destroyed it. And the name of the city was called Hormah.

GenZ: So, like, Judah totally conquered Gaza and all the places nearby, like Askelon and Ekron and their surrounding areas.
Norm: Also Judah took Gaza with the coast thereof, and Askelon with the coast thereof, and Ekron with the coast thereof.

GenZ: And God was like totally on Judah's side, and they totally dominated the peeps living in the mountains. But they couldn't totally remove the peeps living in the valley 'cause they had some seriously rad iron chariots. Like, impossible to beat!
Norm: And the LORD was with Judah; and he drave out {the inhabitants of} the mountain; but could not drive out the inhabitants of the valley, because they had chariots of iron. {drave...: or, possessed the mountain}

GenZ: So they handed Hebron over to Caleb, just like Moses said, and he kicked out those three Anakite guys from there.
Norm: And they gave Hebron unto Caleb, as Moses said: and he expelled thence the three sons of Anak.

GenZ: So, like, the peeps from Benjamin didn't kick out the Jebusites, who were living in Jerusalem. They, like, decided to share the city... and, believe it or not, they're still chillin' together in Jerusalem even now!
Norm: And the children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites that inhabited Jerusalem; but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem unto this day.

GenZ: And yo, the squad of Joseph was like, 'Let's go up to Bethel.' And guess what? The LORD was vibin' with them, totally on their side.
Norm: And the house of Joseph, they also went up against Bethel: and the LORD {was} with them.

GenZ: So, the Joseph crew decided to check out Bethel, which used to be called Luz.
Norm: And the house of Joseph sent to descry Bethel. (Now the name of the city before {was} Luz.)

GenZ: So, like, these spies peeped this dude coming out of the city, and they were like, 'Hey, can you, like, show us how to get into the city? In return, we'll hook you up with some mercy.'
Norm: And the spies saw a man come forth out of the city, and they said unto him, Shew us, we pray thee, the entrance into the city, and we will shew thee mercy.

GenZ: And when he showed them the way inside the city, they attacked the city with their swords, but they spared the man and his whole fam.
Norm: And when he shewed them the entrance into the city, they smote the city with the edge of the sword; but they let go the man and all his family.

GenZ: So this dude went to Hittite territory, founded a city, and named it Luz. And guess what? That name stuck till now. Pretty cool, huh?
Norm: And the man went into the land of the Hittites, and built a city, and called the name thereof Luz: which {is} the name thereof unto this day.

GenZ: So Manasseh didn't kick out the people living in places like Bethshean, Taanach, Dor, Ibleam, and Megiddo. Instead, the Canaanites decided to stay there.
Norm: Neither did Manasseh drive out {the inhabitants of} Bethshean and her towns, nor Taanach and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Dor and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Ibleam and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo and her towns: but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.

GenZ: So, like, when Israel became all powerful, they were like, 'Okay, Canaanites, you gotta pay up,' instead of like completely kicking them out.
Norm: And it came to pass, when Israel was strong, that they put the Canaanites to tribute, and did not utterly drive them out.

GenZ: Ephraim totally slacked off when it came to kicking out those Canaanites from Gezer. Like, they didn't even bother! So guess what? The Canaanites just chilled in Gezer right alongside them. Yikes.
Norm: Neither did Ephraim drive out the Canaanites that dwelt in Gezer; but the Canaanites dwelt in Gezer among them.

GenZ: Zebulun totally didn't kick out the peeps from Kitron or Nahalol. The Canaanites just chilled with them and started paying them tribute, y'know.
Norm: Neither did Zebulun drive out the inhabitants of Kitron, nor the inhabitants of Nahalol; but the Canaanites dwelt among them, and became tributaries.

GenZ: Asher didn't fully kick out the peeps in Accho, Zidon, Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Aphik, or Rehob:
Norm: Neither did Asher drive out the inhabitants of Accho, nor the inhabitants of Zidon, nor of Ahlab, nor of Achzib, nor of Helbah, nor of Aphik, nor of Rehob:

GenZ: So, like, the Asherites were chilling with the Canaanites, you know, the people who were already living in that place. Instead of kicking them out, they's just coexisting and stuff.
Norm: But the Asherites dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land: for they did not drive them out.

GenZ: So basically, Naphtali didn't fully kick out the people from Bethshemesh and Bethanath. Instead, he just kinda chilled with the Canaanites who already lived there. But hey, the people from Bethshemesh and Bethanath ended up having to pay tribute to them. #CantBeatEmJoinEm
Norm: Neither did Naphtali drive out the inhabitants of Bethshemesh, nor the inhabitants of Bethanath; but he dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land: nevertheless the inhabitants of Bethshemesh and of Bethanath became tributaries unto them.

GenZ: The Amorites totally blocked the children of Dan from coming down into the valley by pressuring them to stay up in the mountain.
Norm: And the Amorites forced the children of Dan into the mountain: for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley:

GenZ: But, like, the Amorites were living in mount Heres in Aijalon and Shaalbim, you know? But the house of Joseph was totally strong and overpowering, so the Amorites ended up becoming their peeps, kinda serving them and stuff. {prevailed: like, was super powerful}
Norm: But the Amorites would dwell in mount Heres in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim: yet the hand of the house of Joseph prevailed, so that they became tributaries. {prevailed: Heb. was heavy}

GenZ: The Amorites controlled the area from Akrabbim and the rocky terrain, all the way up.
Norm: And the coast of the Amorites {was} from the going up to Akrabbim, from the rock, and upward. {the going...: or, Maalehacrabbim}

GenZ: And don't make friends with the people in this place, bros and sistas. Destroy their altars like I told you to, but you totally didn't listen to me. Like, why did you go and do that?
Norm: And ye shall make no league with the inhabitants of this land; ye shall throw down their altars: but ye have not obeyed my voice: why have ye done this?

GenZ: So like, I was totally like, I'm not gonna kick them out in front of you, but they're gonna be super annoying, like thorns in your sides, and their gods are gonna trap you, dude.
Norm: Wherefore I also said, I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be {as thorns} in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare unto you.

GenZ: Yo, listen up, fam. So, like, this angel from the big man upstairs straight up started talking to all the Israelite homies, right? And when they heard what the angel had to say, the whole crew got mad emotional and started crying. It was a real moment, dude.
Norm: And it came to pass, when the angel of the LORD spake these words unto all the children of Israel, that the people lifted up their voice, and wept.

GenZ: So they named that place Bochim, which means 'Weepers,' and they offered sacrifices to the LORD there.
Norm: And they called the name of that place Bochim: and they sacrificed there unto the LORD. {Bochim: that is, Weepers}

GenZ: So, like, after Joshua told the people they could go, all the Israelites went to claim their inheritance and take over the land, you know?
Norm: And when Joshua had let the people go, the children of Israel went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.

GenZ: So, like, the peeps were totally down for the LORD throughout Joshua's whole reign and even after when the OG elders were still kickin'. These legends had actually witnessed all the epic stuff the LORD pulled off for Israel. Like, mad respect.
Norm: And the people served the LORD all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great works of the LORD, that he did for Israel. {outlived: Heb. prolonged days after}

GenZ: And Joshua, the son of Nun, who served the LORD, passed away at the age of one hundred and ten.
Norm: And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died, {being} an hundred and ten years old.

GenZ: So they laid him to rest in the outskirts of his land in Timnathheres, up in the mountains of Ephraim, on the chill north side of the awesome Gaash hill. {Timnathheres: also known as Timnathserah}
Norm: And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnathheres, in the mount of Ephraim, on the north side of the hill Gaash. {Timnathhares: also called, Timnathserah}

GenZ: And then all those old peeps passed away and went to join their ancestors. And a new generation came after them, who were clueless about the LORD and had no idea about the epic stuff He did for Israel.
Norm: And also all that generation were gathered unto their fathers: and there arose another generation after them, which knew not the LORD, nor yet the works which he had done for Israel.

GenZ: So, like, the Israelites totally messed up and did some majorly uncool stuff in God's eyes. They started worshiping other gods called Baalim and stuff, not cool at all, man.
Norm: And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the LORD, and served Baalim:

GenZ: But, like, they totally ditched the LORD God of their ancestors, who totally saved them from Egypt, and started worshipping other gods from the people around them. They were all into these other gods and showed them major respect, which made the LORD super angry, like seriously.
Norm: And they forsook the LORD God of their fathers, which brought them out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the people that {were} round about them, and bowed themselves unto them, and provoked the LORD to anger.

GenZ: And they totally ditched God, and started worshipping Baal and Ashtaroth. SMH.
Norm: And they forsook the LORD, and served Baal and Ashtaroth.

GenZ: The LORD was super mad at Israel and let them get wrecked by spoilers who totally messed them up. Then, he sold them out to their enemies from all sides, to the point where they couldn't even put up a fight anymore.
Norm: And the anger of the LORD was hot against Israel, and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers that spoiled them, and he sold them into the hands of their enemies round about, so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.

GenZ: Wherever they went, the LORD made things go bad for them, just like the LORD said and promised. They were really stressed out.
Norm: Whithersoever they went out, the hand of the LORD was against them for evil, as the LORD had said, and as the LORD had sworn unto them: and they were greatly distressed.

GenZ: But like, the LORD was all like, 'I got you fam,' and raised up these judges who totally saved them from those who were wrecking them. savedd means, like, saved, you know?)
Norm: Nevertheless the LORD raised up judges, which delivered them out of the hand of those that spoiled them. {delivered: Heb. saved}

GenZ: But they totally ignored their judges, completely hooked on other gods and worshipped them. They ditched the righteous path their ancestors followed, disobeying the LORD's commandments, and it was not cool.
Norm: And yet they would not hearken unto their judges, but they went a whoring after other gods, and bowed themselves unto them: they turned quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in, obeying the commandments of the LORD; {but} they did not so.

GenZ: So, like, when God appointed judges, he totally had their back and saved them from their enemies the whole time they were in charge. It's because God felt really bad for them, you know? They were super bummed out and oppressed, and it really got to God.
Norm: And when the LORD raised them up judges, then the LORD was with the judge, and delivered them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it repented the LORD because of their groanings by reason of them that oppressed them and vexed them.
