Norm: Moreover thou knowest also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, {and} what he did to the two captains of the hosts of Israel, unto Abner the son of Ner, and unto Amasa the son of Jether, whom he slew, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon his girdle that {was} about his loins, and in his shoes that {were} on his feet. {shed: Heb. put}

GenZ: So, like, use your smarts and make sure his gray hair doesn't rest in peace when he kicks the bucket.
Norm: Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoar head go down to the grave in peace.

GenZ: Yo, be cool to the dudes from Barzillai's fam, the Gileadites, and let 'em chill at your table, 'cause they had my back when I bounced 'cause of your brother Absalom.
Norm: But shew kindness unto the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Absalom thy brother.

GenZ: Yo, check it out, you still got Shimei, Gera's son, a Benjamite from Bahurim, who seriously cursed me over at Mahanaim. But when I got to the Jordan, he came to meet me, and I made a promise to him in the name of the LORD, saying, I won't kill you with a sword, bro. Word.
Norm: And, behold, {thou hast} with thee Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjamite of Bahurim, which cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim: but he came down to meet me at Jordan, and I sware to him by the LORD, saying, I will not put thee to death with the sword. {grievous: Heb. strong}

GenZ: So like, don't just let him slide, dude. You're totally wise and know exactly what you should do to him. But make sure he pays for his wrongs, even if it means taking him down to the grave with just retribution.
Norm: Now therefore hold him not guiltless: for thou {art} a wise man, and knowest what thou oughtest to do unto him; but his hoar head bring thou down to the grave with blood.

GenZ: After living a full life, David passed away and was laid to rest in the city of David.
Norm: So David slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David.

GenZ: So, David was in charge of Israel for a whole 40 years. He started his reign in Hebron and ruled there for 7 years. Then, he moved to Jerusalem and ruled for another 33 years.
Norm: And the days that David reigned over Israel {were} forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.

GenZ: So Solomon slid into David's throne, a total power move, and his kingdom was totally lit, like, it was on another level.
Norm: Then sat Solomon upon the throne of David his father; and his kingdom was established greatly.

GenZ: So Adonijah, Haggith's son, went to meet Solomon's mom, Bathsheba. And she was like, 'Are you here to cause any trouble?' And he was like, 'Nah, just chillin'.
Norm: And Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. And she said, Comest thou peaceably? And he said, Peaceably.

GenZ: He was like, 'Yo, I got something to tell you.' And she was like, 'Spill the tea!'
Norm: He said moreover, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And she said, Say on.

GenZ: And he was like, you know that the kingdom used to be mine, and, like, all of Israel was supporting me to be the ruler. But, like, things have totally flipped, and now the kingdom belongs to my bro because the Big Guy upstairs said so.
Norm: And he said, Thou knowest that the kingdom was mine, and {that} all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign: howbeit the kingdom is turned about, and is become my brother's: for it was his from the LORD.

GenZ: So like, I've got this one favor to ask. Please don't say no. And she's all like, 'Yeah, sure, spill it.'
Norm: And now I ask one petition of thee, deny me not. And she said unto him, Say on. {deny...: Heb. turn not away my face}

GenZ: So, like, he was all, 'Dude, please talk to King Solomon and ask him for me, because he totally won't refuse, to let me marry Abishag the Shunammite.'
Norm: And he said, Speak, I pray thee, unto Solomon the king, (for he will not say thee nay,) that he give me Abishag the Shunammite to wife.

GenZ: And Bathsheba was like, okay, I gotchu fam, I'll go talk to the king for you.
Norm: And Bathsheba said, Well; I will speak for thee unto the king.

GenZ: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to talk to him about Adonijah. When the king saw her, he got up, greeted her, and took a seat on his throne. He even arranged for a chair to be set up for his mom, who sat on his right side.
Norm: Bathsheba therefore went unto king Solomon, to speak unto him for Adonijah. And the king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself unto her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a seat to be set for the king's mother; and she sat on his right hand.

GenZ: So she's like, I've got this small request, pretty pretty please don't deny me. And the king's like, Sure, go ahead, mom! I won't say no to you.
Norm: Then she said, I desire one small petition of thee; {I pray thee}, say me not nay. And the king said unto her, Ask on, my mother: for I will not say thee nay.

GenZ: And she was like, yo, give Abishag the Shunammite to Adonijah, your bro, as his wife, you know?
Norm: And she said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah thy brother to wife.

GenZ: Yo, listen up, Queen Mother! Why are you going to Abishag the Shunammite to ask for Adonijah? If you want, just go ahead and ask for the whole kingdom! 'Cause guess what? He's my older bro, so he's got a claim too, along with Abiathar the priest and Joab, son of Zeruiah.
Norm: And king Solomon answered and said unto his mother, And why dost thou ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? ask for him the kingdom also; for he {is} mine elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah.

GenZ: And like, King Solomon literally swears by the LORD, and he's all like, Godd better do all sorts of crazy stuff to me, like seriously intense stuff, if Adonijah didn't say this thing that's gonna totally mess up his life.'
Norm: Then king Solomon sware by the LORD, saying, God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah have not spoken this word against his own life.

GenZ: So, like, I swear to God, the Almighty One who made me king and put me on the throne that belonged to my dad David, and who fulfilled the promise of giving me a palace; today, Adonijah will totally face death.
Norm: Now therefore, {as} the LORD liveth, which hath established me, and set me on the throne of David my father, and who hath made me an house, as he promised, Adonijah shall be put to death this day.

GenZ: So King Solomon sent Benaiah, Jehoiada's son, to take care of business, and let's just say things didn't end well for the guy.
Norm: And king Solomon sent by the hand of Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell upon him that he died.

GenZ: The king told Abiathar the priest, 'Go to Anathoth and tend to your own land. You deserve to die, but I won't kill you now because you served in front of God's ark for my father David and went through all the hardships he endured.'
Norm: And unto Abiathar the priest said the king, Get thee to Anathoth, unto thine own fields; for thou {art} worthy of death: but I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou barest the ark of the Lord GOD before David my father, and because thou hast been afflicted in all wherein my father was afflicted. {worthy...: Heb. a man of death}

GenZ: So Solomon kicked Abiathar out from being a priest for the LORD, to make sure that what the LORD said about Eli's family in Shiloh would happen.
Norm: So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priest unto the LORD; that he might fulfil the word of the LORD, which he spake concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.

GenZ: So Joab heard the news because he was hanging out with Adonijah, not with Absalom. Joab got scared and ran to the LORD's hangout spot, grabbing onto the altar for dear life.
Norm: Then tidings came to Joab: for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he turned not after Absalom. And Joab fled unto the tabernacle of the LORD, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.

GenZ: So, like, word got to King Solomon that Joab escaped to the sacred place of the LORD, and guess what, he's chillin' right by the altar. So, Solomon's like, 'Yo, Benaiah, son of Jehoiada, go get him!'
Norm: And it was told king Solomon that Joab was fled unto the tabernacle of the LORD; and, behold, {he is} by the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, fall upon him.

GenZ: So Benaiah went to the place where God was chilling, and he was like, 'Yo, the King wants you to come out.' But the guy was like, 'Nah, I'm staying here and I'm ready to die.' Then Benaiah went back to the King and was like, 'This is what Joab said, and this is how he responded to me.'
Norm: And Benaiah came to the tabernacle of the LORD, and said unto him, Thus saith the king, Come forth. And he said, Nay; but I will die here. And Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me.

GenZ: Then the king was like, 'Yeah, do what he said and tackle him, bury him and all. We gotta make sure to clear Joab's name from spilling innocent blood on me and my fam.'
Norm: And the king said unto him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that thou mayest take away the innocent blood, which Joab shed, from me, and from the house of my father.

GenZ: And God will make him pay for what he did by making him suffer. He attacked two guys who were way cooler and righteous than him, and straight up murdered them. My dad David had no idea about any of this, just to be clear. The dudes he killed were Abner, the boss of Israel's army, and Amasa, the boss of Judah's army.
Norm: And the LORD shall return his blood upon his own head, who fell upon two men more righteous and better than he, and slew them with the sword, my father David not knowing {thereof, to wit}, Abner the son of Ner, captain of the host of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the host of Judah.

GenZ: So Joab and his descendants will bear the responsibility for their actions, paying for it with their own blood. But as for David, his descendants, his household, and his throne, they will enjoy everlasting peace bestowed by the LORD.
Norm: Their blood shall therefore return upon the head of Joab, and upon the head of his seed for ever: but upon David, and upon his seed, and upon his house, and upon his throne, shall there be peace for ever from the LORD.

GenZ: Then Benaiah, Jehoiada's son, went up and took him out, killing him. They buried him in his own crib out in the middle of nowhere.
Norm: So Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up, and fell upon him, and slew him: and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.

GenZ: The king chose Benaiah, Jehoiada's son, to take charge of his army, and Zadok the priest replaced Abiathar.
Norm: And the king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his room over the host: and Zadok the priest did the king put in the room of Abiathar.

GenZ: So the king reached out to Shimei and was like, 'Yo bro, go ahead and build yourself a sick pad in Jerusalem. Settle down there and don't even think about bouncing out.'
Norm: And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Build thee an house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence any whither.

GenZ: Listen up, when you leave and cross over the Kidron brook, you better believe you're heading straight for doom. Your own blood will be on your hands, no doubt about it.
Norm: For it shall be, {that} on the day thou goest out, and passest over the brook Kidron, thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt surely die: thy blood shall be upon thine own head.

GenZ: Shimei was like, 'Yo, the king's words are straight fire. Whatever my lord the king commanded, your boy Shimei got you. And Shimei chilled in Jerusalem for a hot minute.
Norm: And Shimei said unto the king, The saying {is} good: as my lord the king hath said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.

GenZ: So, after three years, two of Shimei's servants decided to dip and bounced to Achish, son of Maachah, the king of Gath. They hit up Shimei like, 'Yo, bro, guess where your servants are? Gath, man!'
Norm: And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away unto Achish son of Maachah king of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying, Behold, thy servants {be} in Gath.

GenZ: So Shimei got up and hopped on his ride, headed to Gath to find his crew. Shimei went, and managed to bring his squad back from Gath.
Norm: And Shimei arose, and saddled his ass, and went to Gath to Achish to seek his servants: and Shimei went, and brought his servants from Gath.

GenZ: So, like, word got to Solomon that Shimei, you know, had dipped from Jerusalem to Gath and then pulled a U-turn.
Norm: And it was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and was come again.

GenZ: So the king texts Shimei and says, 'Bro, remember when I made you swear by the LORD and warned you that if you ever leave or go anywhere, you'll definitely die? And you were like, 'Yeah man, I got it, the word I heard sounds good'.
Norm: And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Did I not make thee to swear by the LORD, and protested unto thee, saying, Know for a certain, on the day thou goest out, and walkest abroad any whither, that thou shalt surely die? and thou saidst unto me, The word {that} I have heard {is} good.

GenZ: So like, why didn't you keep your promise to the LORD and do what I told you to?
Norm: Why then hast thou not kept the oath of the LORD, and the commandment that I have charged thee with?

GenZ: The king straight up told Shimei, like, you know all the messed up stuff you did to my dad David, right? Well, let me break it down for you: God's gonna totally make you pay for all your wickedness, like, it's gonna come back and bite you in the end, man.
Norm: The king said moreover to Shimei, Thou knowest all the wickedness which thine heart is privy to, that thou didst to David my father: therefore the LORD shall return thy wickedness upon thine own head;

GenZ: King Solomon gonna be blessed, and David's throne gonna stay strong in front of the LORD forever.
Norm: And king Solomon {shall be} blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before the LORD for ever.

GenZ: Then the king told Benaiah, Jehoiada's son, to go and take care of him. Benaiah did as he was told and ended up finishing the guy off, so he kicked the bucket. And that's how Solomon became the boss of the kingdom.
Norm: So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; which went out, and fell upon him, that he died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.

GenZ: So Ahaziah was hanging out in his chill chamber in Samaria when he fell through a lattice and got sick, bummer. He was like, 'Yo messengers, go ask Baalzebub, the god of Ekron, if I'm gonna bounce back from this sickness'.
Norm: And Ahaziah fell down through a lattice in his upper chamber that {was} in Samaria, and was sick: and he sent messengers, and said unto them, Go, enquire of Baalzebub the god of Ekron whether I shall recover of this disease.

GenZ: But this super chill angel dude was like, 'Yo, Elijah the Tishbite, get up and meet the squad sent by the king of Samaria. Tell them straight up, don't you realize there's a legit God in Israel? Why are you even bothering to ask Baalzebub, the god of Ekron?'
Norm: But the angel of the LORD said to Elijah the Tishbite, Arise, go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria, and say unto them, {Is it} not because {there is} not a God in Israel, {that} ye go to enquire of Baalzebub the god of Ekron?

GenZ: So, like, God was like, 'Yo, listen up! You can't get off that bed you went on, or else you're gonna die. Bye, Elijah!
Norm: Now therefore thus saith the LORD, Thou shalt not come down from that bed on which thou art gone up, but shalt surely die. And Elijah departed. {Thou shalt...: Heb. The bed whither thou art gone up, thou shalt not come down from it}

GenZ: And when the messengers came back to him, he asked them, why did y'all go and come back?
Norm: And when the messengers turned back unto him, he said unto them, Why are ye now turned back?

GenZ: So, they told him this story: Some dude came up to us and said, 'Yo, go back to the king who sent you and deliver this message to him. The LORD asks, 'Why are you seeking guidance from Baalzebub, the god of Ekron, when you know there's a God in Israel?' So basically, the LORD is saying you won't be leaving that bed you climbed onto. You're gonna die for sure, man.
Norm: And they said unto him, There came a man up to meet us, and said unto us, Go, turn again unto the king that sent you, and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD, {Is it} not because {there is} not a God in Israel, {that} thou sendest to enquire of Baalzebub the god of Ekron? therefore thou shalt not come down from that bed on which thou art gone up, but shalt surely die.

GenZ: And he's like, yo, dudes, who was that guy who came up to you and told you this stuff? What did he look like and all? Like, what's the deal with him?
Norm: And he said unto them, What manner of man {was he} which came up to meet you, and told you these words? {What...: Heb. What was the manner of the man}

GenZ: And they were like, yo, he had a serious mane, and had this wicked leather belt around his waist. And this dude was like, 'Yo, that's Elijah the Tishbite!'
Norm: And they answered him, {He was} an hairy man, and girt with a girdle of leather about his loins. And he said, It {is} Elijah the Tishbite.

GenZ: So the king sent a squad of 50 with their leader. They approached the man of God who was chilling up on a hill. The leader called out to him, saying, 'Hey, holy dude! The king wants you to come down.'
Norm: Then the king sent unto him a captain of fifty with his fifty. And he went up to him: and, behold, he sat on the top of an hill. And he spake unto him, Thou man of God, the king hath said, Come down.

GenZ: 'Yo, so Elijah straight up responds to the captain of fifty like, 'If I'm really a man of God, then bring on that fire from heaven and let it wreck you and your whole squad.' And guess what? That fire actually came down from heaven and totally burned them all up.
Norm: And Elijah answered and said to the captain of fifty, If I {be} a man of God, then let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty. And there came down fire from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty.

GenZ: Then he sent another group of soldiers, about fifty of them along with their captain. The captain respectfully approached the man of God and said, 'Hey, the king wants you to come down right away.'
Norm: Again also he sent unto him another captain of fifty with his fifty. And he answered and said unto him, O man of God, thus hath the king said, Come down quickly.

GenZ: And Elijah was like, yo, if I'm really a man of God, then let fire rain down from heaven and wipe out you and your whole squad. And sure enough, boom! God's fire came down and totally roasted them all.
Norm: And Elijah answered and said unto them, If I {be} a man of God, let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty. And the fire of God came down from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty.

GenZ: Then he sent another captain with his group of fifty. The captain approached Elijah, went down on his knees, and earnestly pleaded, saying, 'Oh, man of God, I humbly ask that you value not only my life but also the lives of these fifty servants of yours.'
Norm: And he sent again a captain of the third fifty with his fifty. And the third captain of fifty went up, and came and fell on his knees before Elijah, and besought him, and said unto him, O man of God, I pray thee, let my life, and the life of these fifty thy servants, be precious in thy sight. {fell: Heb. bowed}

GenZ: Yo, check it out, fire straight up rained down from the sky and totally roasted those two leaders and their crews. So, like, can you please consider my life valuable now?
Norm: Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up the two captains of the former fifties with their fifties: therefore let my life now be precious in thy sight.

GenZ: And the angel of the LORD was like, 'Yo Elijah, go down with him, don't be scared, bro.' So Elijah was like, 'Alright, bet,' and went down with him to the king.
Norm: And the angel of the LORD said unto Elijah, Go down with him: be not afraid of him. And he arose, and went down with him unto the king.

GenZ: And he was like, 'Yo, listen up! The LORD has something to say. So, you sent your boys to ask Baalzebub, the so-called god of Ekron, if it's because you think there's no God in Israel who can answer your questions? Well, I got news for you, bro. Since you did that, you ain't getting off that bed you climbed onto, and you're gonna die for sure.'
Norm: And he said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Forasmuch as thou hast sent messengers to enquire of Baalzebub the god of Ekron, {is it} not because {there is} no God in Israel to enquire of his word? therefore thou shalt not come down off that bed on which thou art gone up, but shalt surely die.

GenZ: And just as the LORD had said through Elijah, he passed away. Then Jehoram took over as king in the second year of Jehoram, the son of Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, since he didn't have any sons.
Norm: So he died according to the word of the LORD which Elijah had spoken. And Jehoram reigned in his stead in the second year of Jehoram the son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah; because he had no son.

GenZ: Yo, all the other stuff Ahaziah did, isn't it all written down in that book about the Kings of Israel?
Norm: Now the rest of the acts of Ahaziah which he did, {are} they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

GenZ: And Elijah was like, yo Elisha, just chill here for a sec because the big man upstairs sent me to Bethel. And Elisha was like, swear on the Lord and swear on your own life, I'm not ditching you. So they both rolled down to Bethel.
Norm: And Elijah said unto Elisha, Tarry here, I pray thee; for the LORD hath sent me to Bethel. And Elisha said {unto him, As} the LORD liveth, and {as} thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they went down to Bethel.

GenZ: So, like, these guys who were training to be prophets at Bethel came up to Elisha and said, 'Yo dude, do you know that the LORD is gonna snatch your teacher away from you today?' And Elisha was like, 'Yeah man, I'm aware, so just chill and keep quiet about it, okay?'
Norm: And the sons of the prophets that {were} at Bethel came forth to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the LORD will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he said, Yea, I know {it}; hold ye your peace.

GenZ: And Elijah was like, 'Yo Elisha, chill here for a sec, 'cause the LORD sent me to Jericho.' And Elisha was like, 'Swear, man! I ain't ditching you, not even if my life depended on it!' So they rolled up to Jericho together.
Norm: And Elijah said unto him, Elisha, tarry here, I pray thee; for the LORD hath sent me to Jericho. And he said, {As} the LORD liveth, and {as} thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho.

GenZ: So, like, the prophets' guys in Jericho went up to Elisha and were all, 'Hey, do you know that the LORD is gonna take your boss away from you today?' And Elisha was like, 'Yeah, I'm totally aware of that, so just chill and keep quiet, okay?'}
Norm: And the sons of the prophets that {were} at Jericho came to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the LORD will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he answered, Yea, I know {it}; hold ye your peace.

GenZ: And Elijah was like, 'Yo, dude, chill here for a bit, 'cause the LORD hooked me up to go to the Jordan river.' And the other guy was like, 'OMG, swear on the LORD and your life, I'm not gonna leave you!' So they both kept going together, no doubt.
Norm: And Elijah said unto him, Tarry, I pray thee, here; for the LORD hath sent me to Jordan. And he said, {As} the LORD liveth, and {as} thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And they two went on.

GenZ: Fifty dudes from the sons of the prophets went over there and took a chill spot to scope things out from a distance, while these two just kicked it by the Jordan river.
Norm: And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood to view afar off: and they two stood by Jordan. {to view: Heb. in sight, or, over against}

GenZ: Then Elijah grabbed his cloak and wrapped it up. He hit the water and bam, it split in two, opening up a path for them to walk on dry land.
Norm: And Elijah took his mantle, and wrapped {it} together, and smote the waters, and they were divided hither and thither, so that they two went over on dry ground.

GenZ: So, when they had crossed over, Elijah said to Elisha, 'Yo, ask me what I can do for you before I bounce. And Elisha was like, 'Bro, please hook me up with a double dose of your spirit.'
Norm: And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.

GenZ: And he was like, 'Bro, you're asking for something really difficult. But, if you actually witness me disappearing right in front of you, then okay, you can have it. But if you don't see it happen, then sorry, it's not gonna go down like that. Just saying, you asked for something pretty tough.'
Norm: And he said, Thou hast asked a hard thing: {nevertheless}, if thou see me {when I am} taken from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be {so}. {Thou hast...: Heb. Thou hast done hard in asking}

GenZ: While they were walking and chatting, suddenly this epic scene unfolded: a lit chariot with fire vibes and fiery horses rolled in and split the two apart; Elijah straight up ascended to heaven, riding on a whirlwind. It was insane!
Norm: And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, {there appeared} a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, and parted them both asunder; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.

GenZ: Then Elisha saw it and exclaimed, 'OMG, dad, dad, you were like the ultimate ride of Israel with your sick chariot and horsemen. And just like that, you were gone. Elisha couldn't handle it, so he pulled a serious fashion move, tearing his clothes into two pieces.
Norm: And Elisha saw {it}, and he cried, My father, my father, the chariot of Israel, and the horsemen thereof. And he saw him no more: and he took hold of his own clothes, and rent them in two pieces.

GenZ: Then he picked up Elijah's cool jacket that fell off him, and went back and stood by the riverside, you know, by the Jordan River. Just saying, 'bank' in Hebrew is 'lip',
Norm: He took up also the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and went back, and stood by the bank of Jordan; {bank: Heb. lip}

GenZ: So he grabbed Elijah's jacket that had fallen from him, and hit the water, saying, 'Where's the LORD God of Elijah?' And when he hit the water too, it split apart, making a path for Elisha to cross.
Norm: And he took the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and smote the waters, and said, Where {is} the LORD God of Elijah? and when he also had smitten the waters, they parted hither and thither: and Elisha went over.

GenZ: And when the dudes who followed the prophets and were hanging out in Jericho caught sight of Elisha, they were like, 'Yo, Elijah's spirit is totally on him!' So they went up to him, paid mad respect, and bowed down before him.
Norm: And when the sons of the prophets which {were} to view at Jericho saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha. And they came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.

GenZ: Yo, listen up! So, like, check it: we got around fifty tough dudes here, right? How 'bout we send 'em vibes to go find your master, just in case the Spirit of the LORD, like, whisked him away to some mountain or valley or sumthin'. But the dude was like, nah, don't even bother sending 'em.
Norm: And they said unto him, Behold now, there be with thy servants fifty strong men; let them go, we pray thee, and seek thy master: lest peradventure the Spirit of the LORD hath taken him up, and cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley. And he said, Ye shall not send. {strong...: Heb. sons of strength} {some mountain: Heb. one of the mountains}

GenZ: And when they kept bugging him until he couldn't take it anymore, he was like, 'Fine, whatever.' So they sent fifty dudes to look for three whole days, but they couldn't find him anywhere.
Norm: And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he said, Send. They sent therefore fifty men; and they sought three days, but found him not.

GenZ: So, when they came back to him, (because he was chilling in Jericho,) he straight up told them, 'Didn't I already tell y'all not to go?'
Norm: And when they came again to him, (for he tarried at Jericho,) he said unto them, Did I not say unto you, Go not?

GenZ: So the guys in the city were like, yo Elisha, check out this city, it looks pretty cool, right? But dude, our water is totally messed up, and the ground here can't grow anything. It sucks, man.
Norm: And the men of the city said unto Elisha, Behold, I pray thee, the situation of this city {is} pleasant, as my lord seeth: but the water {is} naught, and the ground barren. {barren: Heb. causing to miscarry}

GenZ: Then he was like, yo, get me a fresh container and put salt in it. And they brought it to him.
Norm: And he said, Bring me a new cruse, and put salt therein. And they brought {it} to him.

GenZ: So he went to this sick water source, and just Yeeted some salt in there, and was like, 'Yo, listen up! The big man upstairs said I've healed this water, so no more death or boring dryness in this place.'
Norm: And he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast the salt in there, and said, Thus saith the LORD, I have healed these waters; there shall not be from thence any more death or barren {land}.

GenZ: So like, the water totally got healed and it's been that way till today, just like what Elisha said would happen.
Norm: So the waters were healed unto this day, according to the saying of Elisha which he spake.

GenZ: So, he left that place and went up to Bethel. And as he was walking along, a group of kids came out of the city and started making fun of him, saying, 'Hey, Mr. Baldie, go up! Hey, Mr. Baldie, go up!'
Norm: And he went up from thence unto Bethel: and as he was going up by the way, there came forth little children out of the city, and mocked him, and said unto him, Go up, thou bald head; go up, thou bald head.

GenZ: Then he turned around and saw them, and he got really angry and called down some serious bad vibes in the name of the LORD. And out of nowhere, two angry she-bears came charging out of the woods and totally wrecked forty-two of those kids.
Norm: And he turned back, and looked on them, and cursed them in the name of the LORD. And there came forth two she bears out of the wood, and tare forty and two children of them.

GenZ: Then he went to Mount Carmel, and after that, he headed back to Samaria.
Norm: And he went from thence to mount Carmel, and from thence he returned to Samaria.

GenZ: Kenan, Mahalaleel, Jered,
Norm: Kenan, Mahalaleel, Jered,

GenZ: LOL, Henoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
Norm: Henoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

GenZ: Yo, we got Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth in the house!
Norm: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

GenZ: The fam of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
Norm: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

GenZ: And Gomer had sons named Ashchenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah. (Some copies also mention Diphath instead of Riphath)
Norm: And the sons of Gomer; Ashchenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah. {Riphath: or, Diphath as it is in some copies}

GenZ: And Javan had these sons: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim. (Some copies say Rodanim instead of Dodanim)
Norm: And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim. {Dodanim: or, Rodanim, according to some copies}

GenZ: So, like, Ham had these sons: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
Norm: The sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

GenZ: These were the descendants of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabtecha. And from Raamah came Sheba and Dedan.
Norm: And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raamah, and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.

GenZ: And Cush had a son named Nimrod: he totally started flexing and becoming super powerful on the planet.
Norm: And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be mighty upon the earth.

GenZ: Mizraim had kids named Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, and Naphtuhim.
Norm: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

GenZ: And there were Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (from whom the Philistines originated), and the Caphthorim.
Norm: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (of whom came the Philistines,) and Caphthorim.

GenZ: And Canaan had a kid named Zidon, who was his oldest, and also Heth.
Norm: And Canaan begat Zidon his firstborn, and Heth,

GenZ: The Jebusite, the Amorite, and the Girgashite were all there too,
Norm: The Jebusite also, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,

GenZ: There were also the Hivites, Arkites, and Sinites,
Norm: And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,

GenZ: And like, there were these Arvadite dudes, and the Zemarite squad, and the Hamathite homies.
Norm: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

GenZ: Shem's squad consisted of Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech (also known as Mash).
Norm: The sons of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech. {Meshech: or, Mash}

GenZ: And Arphaxad had a son named Shelah, and Shelah had a son named Eber.
Norm: And Arphaxad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.

GenZ: Eber had two sons - one named Peleg, because in his time the Earth was split, and his brother named Joktan. Peleg means division.
Norm: And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of the one {was} Peleg; because in his days the earth was divided: and his brother's name {was} Joktan. {Peleg: that is, division}

GenZ: And Joktan had Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
Norm: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

GenZ: Hadoram, Uzal, and Diklah were also there,
Norm: Hadoram also, and Uzal, and Diklah,

GenZ: Like, there were these dudes named Ebal, Abimael, and Sheba,
Norm: And Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

GenZ: And there were Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. Joktan was their dad, you know.
Norm: And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these {were} the sons of Joktan.

GenZ: Shem, Arphaxad, and Shelah, yo,
Norm: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,

GenZ: Eber, Peleg, Reu, bro,
Norm: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

GenZ: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
Norm: Serug, Nahor, Terah,

GenZ: Abram? Yeah, that's Abraham, fam.
Norm: Abram; the same {is} Abraham.

GenZ: Abraham had two sons - Isaac and Ishmael. Just that, homies.
Norm: The sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.

GenZ: Here's the fam lineage: Ishmael's firstborn was Nebaioth, followed by Kedar, Adbeel, and Mibsam,
Norm: These {are} their generations: The firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

GenZ: Yo, we got Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema, aka Hadad or Hadar.
Norm: Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema, {Hadad: also called, Hadar}

GenZ: Yo, check it out - we got Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. Those are the homies, Ishmael's sons.
Norm: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

GenZ: So Abraham had some more kids with his side chick, Keturah. She had Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. And Jokshan had two sons, Sheba and Dedan.
Norm: Now the sons of Keturah, Abraham's concubine: she bare Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan; Sheba, and Dedan.

GenZ: And Midian had some chill sons - Ephah, Epher, Henoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All of them were Keturah's fam.
Norm: And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Henoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these {are} the sons of Keturah.

GenZ: And Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac had two sons: Esau and Israel.
Norm: And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.

GenZ: Esau's kids were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.
Norm: The sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.

GenZ: Eliphaz had some chill sons: Teman, Omar, Zephi (or Zepho), Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.
Norm: The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek. {Zephi: or, Zepho}

GenZ: Reuel's sons: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. 💯
Norm: The sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

GenZ: Bruh, check out these homies, the sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
Norm: And the sons of Seir; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan.

GenZ: So, like, Lotan had these sons, you know? Hori, Homam, and Timna, who was Lotan's sister. (Homam can also be called Hemam, just FYI.)
Norm: And the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna {was} Lotan's sister. {Homam: or, Hemam}

GenZ: Shobal's kids were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. Zibeon's kids were Aiah and Anah. (Alian was also known as Alvan, and Shephi was also called Shepho.)
Norm: The sons of Shobal; Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah. {Alian: also called, Alvan} {Shephi: also called, Shepho}

GenZ: Anah had a kid named Dishon and Dishon had four kids - Amram, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran. (Amram could also be called Hemdan)
Norm: The sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran. {Amram: or, Hemdan}

GenZ: The squad of Ezer had Bilhan, Zavan, and Jakan in it. Dishan's crew included Uz and Aran. (Jakan is also known as Akan.)
Norm: The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zavan, {and} Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran. {Jakan: or, Akan}

GenZ: So, these were the kings who ruled in Edom before any king ruled over the Israelites, starting with Bela, the son of Beor, who was the ruler of the city called Dinhabah.
Norm: Now these {are} the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before {any} king reigned over the children of Israel; Bela the son of Beor: and the name of his city {was} Dinhabah.

GenZ: Once Bela kicked the bucket, Jobab, Zerah's kid from Bozrah, took over the kingdom.
Norm: And when Bela was dead, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.

GenZ: So after Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites took over as ruler.
Norm: And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.

GenZ: And after Husham passed away, Hadad, Bedad's son, who defeated Midian in the territory of Moab, became the new ruler. He named his city Avith.
Norm: And when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, which smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city {was} Avith.

GenZ: And once Hadad passed away, Samlah of Masrekah took over as the new ruler.
Norm: And when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.

GenZ: And yo, when Samlah passed away, Shaul from Rehoboth by the river took over the throne in his place.
Norm: And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.

GenZ: And after Shaul passed away, Baalhanan, Achbor's son, became king in his place.
Norm: And when Shaul was dead, Baalhanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.

GenZ: After Baalhanan died, Hadad took over as ruler. He ruled from the city called Pai and his wife's name was Mehetabel. She was the daughter of Matred and the granddaughter of Mezahab. Some also call Hadad by the name Hadar and Pai by the name Pau.
Norm: And when Baalhanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the name of his city {was} Pai; and his wife's name {was} Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab. {Hadad: or, Hadar} {Pai: or, Pau}

GenZ: Hadad also bit the dust. And the cool kids of Edom were: Timnah, the leader of the pack, Aliah, the influencer, and Jetheth, the boss.
Norm: Hadad died also. And the dukes of Edom were; duke Timnah, duke Aliah, duke Jetheth,

GenZ: The key players in the game were Aholibamah, Elah, and Pinon,
Norm: Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,

GenZ: Yo, Kenaz, Teman, and Mibzar holdin' it down as the top dukes!
Norm: Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,

GenZ: Yo, Magdiel and Iram holdin' it down as bosses in Edom. These are the top dogs.
Norm: Duke Magdiel, duke Iram. These {are} the dukes of Edom.

GenZ: Bruh, we got Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin in the mix. We can't forget Naphtali, Gad, and Asher too.
Norm: Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

GenZ: The dudes from Judah were Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him through a girl named Shua, who was a Canaanite. Now, Judah's firstborn, Er, didn't exactly have good vibes with the LORD. In fact, the LORD wasn't really feeling him and ended up taking him out.
Norm: The sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah: {which} three were born unto him of the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess. And Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the sight of the LORD; and he slew him.

GenZ: And Tamar, his daughter-in-law, gave birth to Pharez and Zerah. Judah had a total of five sons.
Norm: And Tamar his daughter in law bare him Pharez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah {were} five.

GenZ: The homies of Pharez were Hezron and Hamul.
Norm: The sons of Pharez; Hezron, and Hamul.

GenZ: Here are the names of Zerah's sons: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara. Five of them in total. Zimri could also be called Zabdi, and Dara could also be called Darda.
Norm: And the sons of Zerah; Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara: five of them in all. {Zimri: or, Zabdi} {Dara: or, Darda}

GenZ: The dudes from Carmi were Achar, the one causing trouble for Israel. He totally messed up and broke the rules by taking something that was cursed. {Achar: or, Achan}
Norm: And the sons of Carmi; Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the thing accursed. {Achar: or, Achan}

GenZ: And Ethan's squad was lit with his son, Azariah.
Norm: And the sons of Ethan; Azariah.

GenZ: Hezron had three sons, named Jerahmeel, Ram (also known as Aram) and Chelubai (also called Caleb).
Norm: The sons also of Hezron, that were born unto him; Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai. {Ram: Gr. Aram} {Chelubai: or, Caleb}

GenZ: So, Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the dad of Nahshon, who was like the awesome ruler of the people from the tribe of Judah.
Norm: And Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;

GenZ: Nahshon was the real OG who gave birth to Salma, who then passed on the vibes and brought Boaz into this world. (Salma was known as Salmon too, just FYI)
Norm: And Nahshon begat Salma, and Salma begat Boaz, {Salma: also called, Salmon}

GenZ: And Boaz became the proud parent of Obed, and Obed became the proud parent of Jesse,
Norm: And Boaz begat Obed, and Obed begat Jesse,

GenZ: And Jesse had his firstborn Eliab, then Abinadab came next, and Shimma came after him, {Shimma: or, Shammah}
Norm: And Jesse begat his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimma the third, {Shimma: or, Shammah}

GenZ: Nethaneel be rollin' in at four, Raddai takin' it to the next level at number five,
Norm: Nethaneel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

GenZ: Ozem #6, David #7:
Norm: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh:

GenZ: Zeruiah and Abigail were like, the sisters, ya know? And Zeruiah had three sons: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.
Norm: Whose sisters {were} Zeruiah, and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah; Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.

GenZ: Abigail had a son named Amasa, and his dad was Jether the Ishmeelite. (Jether, also known as Ithra, was an Israelite.)
Norm: And Abigail bare Amasa: and the father of Amasa {was} Jether the Ishmeelite. {Jether...: also called, Ithra an Israelite}

GenZ: And Caleb, Hezron's son, had children with his wife Azubah and Jerioth. Their sons were Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
Norm: And Caleb the son of Hezron begat {children} of Azubah {his} wife, and of Jerioth: her sons {are} these; Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.

GenZ: When Azubah passed away, Caleb decided to marry Ephrath, who then gave birth to his son named Hur.
Norm: And when Azubah was dead, Caleb took unto him Ephrath, which bare him Hur.

GenZ: And Hur had a kid named Uri, and Uri had a kid named Bezaleel.
Norm: And Hur begat Uri, and Uri begat Bezaleel.

GenZ: And then Hezron got together with the daughter of Machir, Gilead's dad, and they got hitched when he hit the big 6-0; and she gave birth to Segub.
Norm: And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he {was} threescore years old; and she bare him Segub. {married: Heb. took}

GenZ: And Segub had a son named Jair, who was totally ballin' with twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
Norm: And Segub begat Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.

GenZ: And he totally conquered Geshur and Aram, along with all the cool cities of Jair, including Kenath and its surrounding towns. Yep, he basically took over sixty cities! All of this was owned by the awesome sons of Machir, who was the father of Gilead.
Norm: And he took Geshur, and Aram, with the towns of Jair, from them, with Kenath, and the towns thereof, {even} threescore cities. All these {belonged to} the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.

GenZ: And when Hezron passed away in Calebephratah, his wife Abiah gave birth to Ashur, the father of Tekoa.
Norm: And after that Hezron was dead in Calebephratah, then Abiah Hezron's wife bare him Ashur the father of Tekoa.

GenZ: The oldest son of Hezron, Jerahmeel, had some cool sons: Ram, who was the firstborn, and there's also Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
Norm: And the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were, Ram the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, {and} Ahijah.

GenZ: Jerahmeel had another wife named Atarah and she was the mother of Onam too.
Norm: Jerahmeel had also another wife, whose name {was} Atarah; she {was} the mother of Onam.

GenZ: Ram, who was Jerahmeel's firstborn, had three sons: Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
Norm: And the sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were, Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.

GenZ: The dudes Onam had two sons, Shammai and Jada. Shammai's sons were named Nadab and Abishur.
Norm: And the sons of Onam were, Shammai, and Jada. And the sons of Shammai; Nadab, and Abishur.

GenZ: Abishur's wife was named Abihail, and together they had Ahban and Molid.
Norm: And the name of the wife of Abishur {was} Abihail, and she bare him Ahban, and Molid.

GenZ: And Nadab's sons were Seled and Appaim, but Seled passed away without having kids.
Norm: And the sons of Nadab; Seled, and Appaim: but Seled died without children.

GenZ: And Appaim had a son named Ishi. Ishi had a son named Sheshan. And Sheshan had some children, including Ahlai.
Norm: And the sons of Appaim; Ishi. And the sons of Ishi; Sheshan. And the children of Sheshan; Ahlai.

GenZ: So like, Jada's bro Shammai had these sons, Jether and Jonathan. But Jether, he didn't have any kids and died, man.
Norm: And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai; Jether, and Jonathan: and Jether died without children.

GenZ: And Jonathan had two sons named Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
Norm: And the sons of Jonathan; Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

GenZ: So, Sheshan didn't have any sons, just daughters. And he had this servant, who was an Egyptian dude named Jarha.
Norm: Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name {was} Jarha.

GenZ: So Sheshan arranged for his daughter to marry his servant, Jarha, and they had a son named Attai.
Norm: And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant to wife; and she bare him Attai.

GenZ: And Attai had a son named Nathan, and Nathan had a son named Zabad,
Norm: And Attai begat Nathan, and Nathan begat Zabad,

GenZ: And Zabad had a kid named Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed,
Norm: And Zabad begat Ephlal, and Ephlal begat Obed,

GenZ: And Obed had a kid named Jehu, and Jehu had a kid named Azariah,
Norm: And Obed begat Jehu, and Jehu begat Azariah,

GenZ: And Azariah had a kid named Helez, who then had a kid named Eleasah,
Norm: And Azariah begat Helez, and Helez begat Eleasah,

GenZ: And Eleasah had a kid named Sisamai, and Sisamai had a kid named Shallum,
Norm: And Eleasah begat Sisamai, and Sisamai begat Shallum,

GenZ: And Shallum had a kid named Jekamiah, and Jekamiah had a kid named Elishama.
Norm: And Shallum begat Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begat Elishama.

GenZ: So, like, Caleb's bro Jerahmeel had some sons. First up was Mesha, who was the father of Ziph. And then there were the sons of Mareshah, who was the father of Hebron.
Norm: Now the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel {were}, Mesha his firstborn, which was the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.

GenZ: The homies from Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
Norm: And the sons of Hebron; Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.

GenZ: And Shema became the dad of Raham, who was the cool parent of Jorkoam. And Rekem became the dad of Shammai.
Norm: And Shema begat Raham, the father of Jorkoam: and Rekem begat Shammai.

GenZ: Shammai had a son named Maon, who became the father of Bethzur.
Norm: And the son of Shammai {was} Maon: and Maon {was} the father of Bethzur.

GenZ: So Ephah, Caleb's concubine, had sons named Haran, Moza, and Gazez. And Haran was the father of Gazez.
Norm: And Ephah, Caleb's concubine, bare Haran, and Moza, and Gazez: and Haran begat Gazez.

GenZ: And Jahdai had these sons: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
Norm: And the sons of Jahdai; Regem, and Jotham, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.

GenZ: Maachah, Caleb's side babe, had Sheber and Tirhanah.
Norm: Maachah, Caleb's concubine, bare Sheber, and Tirhanah.

GenZ: She also had Shaaph, who was the dad of Madmannah, Sheva, the dad of Machbenah, and the dad of Gibea. And Caleb's daughter's name was Achsah.
Norm: She bare also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah, and the father of Gibea: and the daughter of Caleb {was} Achsah.

GenZ: These dudes were the sons of Caleb, who came from Hur, the oldest son of Ephratah. Shobal was the dad of Kirjathjearim, (also known as Ephreth).
Norm: These were the sons of Caleb the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratah; Shobal the father of Kirjathjearim, {Ephratah: also called, Ephreth}

GenZ: Salma was the OG of Bethlehem, and Hareph was the OG of Bethgader.
Norm: Salma the father of Bethlehem, Hareph the father of Bethgader.

GenZ: Yo, Shobal, he's the dad of Kirjathjearim and he got some kids, Haroeh and like, half of the Manahethites. You feel? Haroeh is also known as Reaiah. And, um, when we say 'half of the Manahethites,' it could mean like, half of the Menuchites or Hatsihammenuchoth, you know what I'm saying?
Norm: And Shobal the father of Kirjathjearim had sons; Haroeh, {and} half of the Manahethites. {Haroeh: or, Reaiah} {half...: or, half of the Menuchites, or, Hatsihammenuchoth}

GenZ: And there were these cool tribes in Kirjathjearim: the Ithrites, the Puhites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. And out of them came the Zareathites and the Eshtaulites, no biggie.
Norm: And the families of Kirjathjearim; the Ithrites, and the Puhites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zareathites, and the Eshtaulites.

GenZ: Some of Salma's descendants were from Bethlehem and the Netophathites. Then there were those from Ataroth and the house of Joab, as well as half of the Manahethites and the Zorites. By the way, Ataroth could also be known as Atarites or crowns of the house of Joab, just FYI! 😇
Norm: The sons of Salma; Bethlehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Manahethites, the Zorites. {Ataroth...: or, Atarites, or, crowns of the house of Joab}

GenZ: And there were these really cool families of scribes that lived in Jabez, like the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Suchathites. Oh, and let's not forget about the Kenites who are descendants of Hemath, the awesome founder of the Rechab clan!
Norm: And the families of the scribes which dwelt at Jabez; the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, {and} Suchathites. These {are} the Kenites that came of Hemath, the father of the house of Rechab.

GenZ: So Solomon assigned 70k people to carry heavy stuff, 80k people to cut and shape rocks in the mountains, and 3.6k people to supervise them all.
Norm: And Solomon told out threescore and ten thousand men to bear burdens, and fourscore thousand to hew in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them.

GenZ: So, Solomon hit up King Huram of Tyre and was like, 'Yo, remember how you helped out my dad David by sending him cedars to build his crib? Well, I'm on the same wave, so hook me up too!'}
Norm: And Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre, saying, As thou didst deal with David my father, and didst send him cedars to build him an house to dwell therein, {even so deal with me}. {Huram: or, Hiram}

GenZ: Yo, listen up! I'm building a sick pad in honor of the LORD my God. Gonna dedicate it to Him and burn some dope incense, keep that bread fresh round the clock, and offer burnt sacrifices in the morning and evening. Oh, and don't forget the sabbaths, new moons, and epic feasts of our awesome God. This is a forever deal for Israel, ya feel?
Norm: Behold, I build an house to the name of the LORD my God, to dedicate {it} to him, {and} to burn before him sweet incense, and for the continual shewbread, and for the burnt offerings morning and evening, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the solemn feasts of the LORD our God. This {is an ordinance} for ever to Israel. {sweet...: Heb. incense of spices}

GenZ: Yo, the crib I'm building is straight fire, 'cause our God is the GOAT of all gods, no cap.
Norm: And the house which I build {is} great: for great {is} our God above all gods.

GenZ: But, like, who can even build a house for God? I mean, even the heavens and the highest heavens can't contain Him. So, like, who am I to think that I can build Him a house, except maybe to offer sacrifices to Him?
Norm: But who is able to build him an house, seeing the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain him? who {am} I then, that I should build him an house, save only to burn sacrifice before him? {is able: Heb. hath retained, or, obtained strength}

GenZ: Yo, I need someone who's hella skilled in crafting all kinds of bling. We're talking gold, silver, brass, iron – you name it. But wait, there's more! They gotta be able to do some sick engravings, like the pros back in Judah and Jerusalem. My dad David came through with the skilled homies – gotta keep up the legacy, fam! #ArtisticSkills
Norm: Send me now therefore a man cunning to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and that can skill to grave with the cunning men that {are} with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father did provide. {to grave: Heb. to grave gravings}

GenZ: Hey, I need you to hook me up with some sick cedar trees, fir trees, and algum trees from Lebanon. I know your crew is legit when it comes to handling timber in Lebanon. And check it, my squad will join your squad, like, team work makes the dream work, right? Oh, by the way, algum is also known as almuggim. Just so you know!
Norm: Send me also cedar trees, fir trees, and algum trees, out of Lebanon: for I know that thy servants can skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and, behold, my servants {shall be} with thy servants, {algum: also called, almuggim}

GenZ: I need a ton of timber, like, a crazy amount, for this super amazing house I'm about to build. It's gonna be mind-blowingly epic, like, way beyond great. Seriously, it'll be legendary!
Norm: Even to prepare me timber in abundance: for the house which I am about to build {shall be} wonderful great. {wonderful...: Heb. great and wonderful}

GenZ: Yo, check it out, I'm hooking up your crew—those timber choppers—with 20K measures of prime wheat, 20K measures of barley, and 20K baths of wine and oil. It's gonna be lit!
Norm: And, behold, I will give to thy servants, the hewers that cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.

GenZ: So, like, King Huram of Tyre, he sent Solomon a message and was like, 'Yo, bro! The Lord straight up loves his peeps, so he chose you to be their king!'
Norm: Then Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon, Because the LORD hath loved his people, he hath made thee king over them.

GenZ: Huram was like, yo, shoutout to the LORD God of Israel, the G.O.A.T who created the whole universe! He blessed David with a son who's super smart and wise, and totally equipped to build a sick house for the LORD and a rad kingdom crib. The son is all about that wisdom and understanding, you feel me?
Norm: Huram said moreover, Blessed {be} the LORD God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who hath given to David the king a wise son, endued with prudence and understanding, that might build an house for the LORD, and an house for his kingdom. {endued...: Heb. knowing prudence and understanding}

GenZ: And now I've sent a really smart dude, who's got mad skills and is wise, just like my dad, Huram!
Norm: And now I have sent a cunning man, endued with understanding, of Huram my father's,

GenZ: The guy's mom was from the daughters of Dan and his dad was a skilled artist in working with gold, silver, brass, iron, stone, and timber. He could also handle purple, blue, fine linen, and crimson. He was a pro at all types of engravings and could come up with any kind of design that was thrown at him. He was up there with the skilled artists like the ones your dad King David had.
Norm: The son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, and his father {was} a man of Tyre, skilful to work in gold, and in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue, and in fine linen, and in crimson; also to grave any manner of graving, and to find out every device which shall be put to him, with thy cunning men, and with the cunning men of my lord David thy father.

GenZ: So like, the wheat, barley, oil, and wine that my Lord talked about, he should totally send them to his peeps, you know?
Norm: Now therefore the wheat, and the barley, the oil, and the wine, which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto his servants:

GenZ: And we're gonna get some wood from Lebanon, like, as much as you need, and we'll ship it to you on some fancy floats all the way to Joppa. Then you can haul it up to Jerusalem and do your thing. {basically, as much as you need} {Joppa: or should I say, Japho}
Norm: And we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shalt need: and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa; and thou shalt carry it up to Jerusalem. {as much...: Heb according to all thy need} {Joppa: Heb. Japho}

GenZ: So, Solomon decided to count all the foreigners living in Israel, just like his dad David had done before. Guess what? There were a whopping total of 150,306 of them! Can you believe it? (By the way, when I say 'foreigners,' I mean those dudes who weren't originally from Israel, ya know? Just clarifying, in case you were wondering.)
Norm: And Solomon numbered all the strangers that {were} in the land of Israel, after the numbering wherewith David his father had numbered them; and they were found an hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred. {the strangers: Heb. the men the strangers}

GenZ: And he assigned 70,000 of them to carry heavy stuff, and 80,000 to chop wood in the mountains, and 3,600 supervisors to manage the workers.
Norm: And he set threescore and ten thousand of them {to be} bearers of burdens, and fourscore thousand {to be} hewers in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred overseers to set the people a work.

GenZ: And he started building on the second day of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.
Norm: And he began to build in the second {day} of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.

GenZ: So here's what Solomon learned when he was getting ready to build God's house. The length of the house was 60 cubits, and the width was 20 cubits. (In case you're wondering, a cubit is a unit of measurement!)
Norm: Now these {are the things wherein} Solomon was instructed for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the first measure {was} threescore cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits. {instructed: Heb. founded}

GenZ: The front porch of the house had the same length as the house itself, measuring twenty cubits, and it stood tall at one hundred and twenty cubits. And it was beautifully adorned with pure gold on the inside.
Norm: And the porch that {was} in the front {of the house}, the length {of it was} according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the height {was} an hundred and twenty: and he overlaid it within with pure gold.

GenZ: And he covered the bigger pad with lit fir wood, then added some dope gold coating on top, and decked it out with palm trees and chains.
Norm: And the greater house he cieled with fir tree, which he overlaid with fine gold, and set thereon palm trees and chains.

GenZ: He decked out the house with mad bling to make it look fly: all the gold he used was straight flexin' Parvaim gold. #deckedout
Norm: And he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty: and the gold {was} gold of Parvaim. {garnished: Heb. covered}

GenZ: He flexed on the whole crib, covering its walls, doors, posts, and beams with solid gold. And to take it up another level, he even carved some sick angelic figures on those walls.
Norm: He overlaid also the house, the beams, the posts, and the walls thereof, and the doors thereof, with gold; and graved cherubims on the walls.

GenZ: And like, he built this super holy place, and it was like, the same length as the whole house, which was like twenty cubits long, and also twenty cubits wide. And he totally covered it in fancy gold, like, six hundred talents worth of it.
Norm: And he made the most holy house, the length whereof {was} according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty cubits: and he overlaid it with fine gold, {amounting} to six hundred talents.

GenZ: And like, the nails were legit made of fifty shekels of gold. And dude totally coated the upper chambers in gold, man.
Norm: And the weight of the nails {was} fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid the upper chambers with gold.

GenZ: And in the super dope holy crib, he crafted two angel dudes with sick artwork and coated them with gold. {image...: or, (like some peeps believe) with movable swag}
Norm: And in the most holy house he made two cherubims of image work, and overlaid them with gold. {image...: or, (as some think) of moveable work}

GenZ: And the wings of the cherubims were super long, like 20 cubits: one wing of one cherub was five cubits, reaching all the way to the wall of the house. And the other wing was also five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.
Norm: And the wings of the cherubims {were} twenty cubits long: one wing {of the one cherub was} five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing {was likewise} five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.

GenZ: And one of the wings of the other cherub was like, super long - about five cubits! It reached all the way to the wall of the house. And the other wing was also five cubits long, totally connecting to the wing of the other cherub.
Norm: And {one} wing of the other cherub {was} five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing {was} five cubits {also}, joining to the wing of the other cherub.

GenZ: These cherubims had their wings spread out to twenty cubits, chillin' on their feet with their faces pointed towards the house.
Norm: The wings of these cherubims spread themselves forth twenty cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their faces {were} inward. {inward: or, toward the house}

GenZ: So, like, he created this curtain thingy with a cool combo of blue, purple, and crimson fabric, made out of the finest linen, and bonus points - he even added some dope cherubims on it. Mind blown! Aww yeah, he totally nailed the design!
Norm: And he made the vail {of} blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and wrought cherubims thereon. {wrought: Heb. caused to ascend}
